page.title: 05MEDIA
page.content: THE DONCASTER STAR The{Doncaster Star}publishes 303 newspapers a year. About 40 letters a week are sent to the Star. The Star has been running for two years. They took over from the{Doncaster Evening {Post}who went out of business. Each newspaper costs 16p. The Star has 10 computers, and 1 main computer, which costs Â£5 000 000. The Star employs 35 people but employs 1000 all over South Yorkshire. Journalists usually work about 9 hours a day, but can work up to 18 hours a day. An important issue in Warmsworth this year was the excessive noise from a youth club which annoyed neighbours. The newspaper is sold and published 6 days a week. 200 shops in the Doncaster area order newspapers from the Doncaster Star.
